Notice.Title: WCC - Singing for Lung Health - AWARD
Notice.Description:
Warwickshire County Council is seeking to commission a single provider to develop and implement a comprehensive Singing for Lung Health programme for adults with chronic respiratory conditions. This will consist of courses of group-based sessions led by an experienced singing specialist.
In Warwickshire, the under 75 mortality rate from respiratory disease was 29 per 100,000 in 2016-18. However, there is significant variation across the county, where Nuneaton and Bedworth have significantly higher premature mortality rates than the national average (44 per 100,000).
Therefore, holistic support is needed for those living with these conditions and improvements in lung health are required. This programme forms part of a wider set of Creative Health programmes to promote creative and cultural activities within Warwickshire to improve health and wellbeing.
The objective is to improve the quality of life for people living with long term respiratory conditions. Delivering health, psychological and social benefits to those with long-term respiratory conditions. Singing for health can be offered both as an early intervention and as tertiary prevention approach (reducing deterioration and improving quality of life) for people living with COPD utilising a non-medical approach to support medical and social needs.

Notice.Title: Work and Health Programme Job Entry: Targeted Support (JETS) Subcontract
Notice.Description:
The WHP JETS will provide light touch, personalised support for a maximum of 182 days.
Elements to include:
• skills analysis including identifying transferable skills - help with support to consider different employment sectors/routes and ways of working, including home working,
• re-building confidence and self-efficacy in Post Covid-19 environment (including support for anxieties about working in a Covid-19 environment with a peer support network, potential access to mental health and wellbeing support),
• advice and guidance for those wishing to change sector (e.g. building on the sector-based "Step Into" guides Providers already use),
• job search support (including CV writing; application process, Interview techniques, including online interviewing).
Notice.OrganisationName: The Shaw Trust Limited

Notice.Title: Provision of Employee Benefits for Health, Wealth and Wellbeing Framework - AWARD
Notice.Description:
This framework shall have up to a maximum of 8 Suppliers who can meet the requirements of this specification. Suppliers shall provide a fully managed service through an online single sign on benefits platform that can deliver as a minimum the 8 Core Benefits listed below:
Core Benefits (Mandatory): - Childcare Vouchers - Car Leasing Scheme - Technology and White Goods Scheme - Cycle to Work Scheme - Gym Membership - Financial Wellbeing Schemes including financial education, savings and access to affordable loans - Leisure and Retail Discounts Scheme including E Gift Cards/E Discount Codes. - Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
Additional Benefits (Non-Mandatory):
These shall include but not be limited to the following: - Online Cycle Shop - Total Rewards Statement - Shared Cost Additional Voluntary Contribution Schemes (SCAVC's) - Reward and Recognition Benefits - Buying and Selling of Annual Leave - Holiday Scheme - Eyecare Scheme

Notice.ProcedureAcceleratedJustification:
"The Department is content the tests permitting use of the Negotiated procedure without prior publication (Regulation 32(2)(c)) are met:

1) Air freight charters was identified as strictly necessary to meet anticipated demand.
2) It is responding to COVID-19 immediately because of public health risks presenting a genuine emergency.
3) The events that led to the need for extreme urgency were unforeseeable: The Commission itself confirmed: "The current coronavirus crisis presents an extreme and unforeseeable urgency - precisely for such a situation our European rules enable public buyers to buy within a matter of days, even hours, if necessary.""
4) There was no time to run an accelerated procurement under the open, restricted or competitive procedures with negotiation that would secure services within the required timescales.
5) The situation is not attributable to the contracting authority: It has not done anything to cause or contribute to the need for extreme urgency"

Notice.Title: PHE Science Hub Provision of Project and Cost Management Services
Notice.Description:
To ensure it remains a world leader in public health, PHE is the process of consolidating three of their existing locations to a new dynamic health science campus located in Harlow, Essex. The PHE transformation programme called the 'Science Hub Programme' consists of both construction and business change elements.
The Science Hub Programme was initiated in 2010 and has progressed through several RIBA stages to date. Most of the construction projects are currently at RIBA Stage 4.
To provide a provision for project and cost management services.

Notice.Description: TT FLIGHTS EX XMN
Notice.OrganisationName: Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC - Logistics Buy)
Notice.ProcedureAcceleratedJustification:
"The Department is content the tests permitting use of the Negotiated procedure without prior publication (Regulation 32(2)(c)) are met:

1) Air freight charters was identified as strictly necessary to meet anticipated demand.
2) It is responding to COVID-19 immediately because of public health risks presenting a genuine emergency.
3) The events that led to the need for extreme urgency were unforeseeable: The Commission itself confirmed: "The current coronavirus crisis presents an extreme and unforeseeable urgency - precisely for such a situation our European rules enable public buyers to buy within a matter of days, even hours, if necessary.""
4) There was no time to run an accelerated procurement under the open, restricted or competitive procedures with negotiation that would secure services within the required timescales.
5) The situation is not attributable to the contracting authority: It has not done anything to cause or contribute to the need for extreme urgency"

Notice.Identifier: Covid-19 Behaviour Change Unit: ActionAid (humanitarian surge support)
Notice.Title: Covid-19 Behaviour Change Unit: ActionAid (humanitarian surge support)
Notice.Description:
The required resource is consultancy support to define the clinical model for the London Fast Track Surgical Hubs and accelerate delivery. This will support the establishment of the London hubs by September.
This scope covers:
- Providing operational management expertise and methodologies - Engaging key stakeholders - Acting as a conduit between clinical and operational working groups - Supporting the clinical and administrative priority setting, pathway design, and implementation - Identification and resolution of operational issues - Facilitation of working groups / workshops - Development of robust governance structures - Working as part of a blended team with NHSEI resources to deliver at pace during this accelerated phase of the programme
The outputs of this work will be:
- A standardised clinical model for the London Fast Track Surgical Hubs - Established London Fast Track Surgical Hubs across the region
These outputs will support NHSEI London to rapidly deliver increased elective activity. The ultimate objective is to reduce the clinical harm to patients resulting from delayed elective treatment.

Notice.Title: NHS Kernow Community Termination of Pregnancy Service
Notice.Description:
Aims and objectives of service
• To provide a consistent, comprehensive, effective, accessible, legal and appropriate termination of pregnancy service to service users • To provide a quality service informed by the Royal College of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists Guideline for the "Care of Women Requesting Induced Abortion" MEDFASH standards for sexual health services, and current best evidence • To ensure that risk of infection and other complications to service users is minimised • To ensure that opportunities to provide sexual health information, contraceptives and screening advice are maximised
Service description/care pathway
The Service will provide: • Counselling & Assessment • A choice of termination of pregnancy methods clinically appropriate for a service user's gestation and clinical circumstances. This includes medical and surgical procedures under both local and general anaesthetic • Contraception - full range of reversible contraceptive options to be available for women on the same day as the procedure • Sexual health and screening advise • Follow up after care

Notice.Title: Personal Dental Services (PDS) in London Prisons and Heathrow Immigration Removal Centre
Notice.Description:
NHS England (hereafter referred to as "the Authority") ran a competitive procurement process to commission Personal Dental Services (PDS) in London Prisons and Heathrow Immigration Removal Centre ("the Service").
From 1 April 2019, NHS England and NHS Improvement are working together as a new single organisation to better support the NHS to deliver improved care for patients. Further information regarding the role and purpose of NHS England and NHS Improvement is available from this url: https://www.england.nhs.uk/about/about-nhs-england/
This procurement was divided into 4 Lots: Lot 1 Immigration Removal Central Heathrow Lot 2 HMP Wandsworth & HMP Brixton Lot 3 HMP Pentonville & HMP Wormwood Scrubs Lot 4 HMP Belmarsh, HMP Thameside and HMP YOI Isis
What is in Scope?
• Full range of PDS mandatory dental services
 examination;  advice and planning of treatment;  periodontal treatment;  surgical treatment;  the taking of radiographs;  the issue of prescriptions,  diagnosis;  preventative care and treatment;  conservative treatment;  supply and repair of dental appliances;  the supply of listed drugs and listed appliances;
• Minor Oral Surgery Sessions (except IRC) • Triage Service • Multi-disciplinary team approach to service delivery including hygienist and oral health educator • Prevention & oral health education • Repair & maintenance of fixed assets and repair maintenance and replacement of non-fixed assets
What is not in Scope?
• Additional services  advanced mandatory services  dental public health services  domiciliary services  orthodontic services  sedation services
• Medicine dispensing and costs - responsibility of healthcare providers
The contract for the Service is awarded for a period of 5 years, with an optional extension for a further period of 2 years (twenty-four months) in two one year increments (5+1+1). Therefore the maximum duration of this contract, if all extension options are taken up will be 7 years (84 months).
Contract Start and End Dates:
HMP Wandsworth & HMP Brixton 01/04/2021 - 31/03/2028 IRC Heathrow 01/09/2021 - 31/08/2028 HMP Pentonville & HMP Wormwood Scrubs 01/12/2021 - 30/11/2028 HMP Belmarsh, HMP Thameside and HMP YOI Isis 01/04/2022 - 31/03/2029

Notice.Title: NHS Calderdale & Greater Huddersfield CCGs: Seamless Home from Hospital Service
Notice.Description:
NHS Calderdale and Greater Huddersfield Clinical Commissioning Groups invite providers who are suitably qualified and experienced healthcare service providers including third sector organisations, social enterprise and other providers to provide a 'Seamless Home from Hospital' (SHFH) service to people from the Calderdale and Greater Huddersfield areas.
The SHFH provides a service to individuals to avoid admission, and those being discharged:
• The service to patients avoiding admission is offered as part of the Integrated Admission Avoidance service, in conjunction with the Hospital Avoidance Teams (HAT). These patients will have presented at A&E at Calderdale and Huddersfield NHS Foundation Trust (CHFT). Clinical staff will have determined no clinical reason to admit the person to an inpatient ward but the patient is frail or vulnerable and needs additional support to ensure their safety and wellbeing to return home. • Patients being discharged will have been inpatients at CHFT or an associated Intermediate Care facility. Patients will be medically fit for discharge however may be frail or vulnerable and need additional support to ensure their safety and well-being going home.
The service will contribute to the delivery of Calderdale and Greater Huddersfield CCG's objectives of promoting health and well-being, and commissioning and providing the best possible care for patients. The aims of the service are to contribute to a reduction in avoidable hospital admissions and delayed transfers of care. Avoidable admissions include admissions from A&E for non-clinical reasons and readmissions after discharge.
Days/Hours of Operation:
On weekdays the SHFH booking line is available 9am-7pm, offering transport from hospital 10am-8pm and support at home 10:30am-9pm. On weekends and bank holidays the SHFH booking line is available 11am-6pm, offering transport from hospital 11am-6pm and support at home 11am-6pm.
Referral Criteria and sources:
• The service shall be made available to frail and vulnerable adults (16 years plus) resident/registered with a GP in Calderdale and Greater Huddersfield CCG areas. • Referrals will be accepted from any discharge coordinator, clinician or support staff acting on behalf of a clinician, HAT team member or hospital social worker based at CRH, HRI or Intermediate Care. • Patients will be collected from any location at CRH, HRI or Intermediate Care.

Notice.Title: Work with the NMC Council and Executive in response to issues highlighted by Black Lives Matter
Notice.Description:
Our registrants and our own workforce are more ethnically diverse than general population. The murder of George Floyd in the USA, the Black Lives Matter protests around the world and the disproportionate impact of Covid19 on the Black, Asian and minority ethnic population and in particular the health and social care workforce, have all had a significant impact on colleagues at the NMC and among the professionals on our register. These events have brought issues of discrimination and racism to the fore and have raised challenging questions that the Council (our Board) and senior team are committed to addressing.
NMC require assistance to ensure the Council and the senior team are able to fully understand the issues we need to address and take meaningful action that will make a difference for all colleagues working at the NMC.

Notice.Title: Positive Behaviour Support Service
Notice.Description: To deliver the requirements set out in the specification for the delivery of a Positive Behaviour Support service for children and young people (CYP) with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and/or moderate to severe Learning Disabilities (LD) within the borough of Hounslow. As an integrated care partnership, the Authority and wider health and care partners across the system want to ensure that all children with ASD/ LD in Hounslow are able to achieve excellent outcomes and reach their full potential, ideally thriving in the communities in which they live and interact. We want CYP in Hounslow with ASD/LD to transition into adulthood independently wherever possible, with sufficient resilience and system support to allow them to achieve their chosen outcomes. As part of our ongoing strategic plan, the Authority wishes to create a dynamic behaviour support service that is able to appropriately manage the needs of CYP with ASD/LD and to sustainably keep at-risk CYP with ASD/LD from being hospitalised or placed into residential care.

Notice.Title: Special Educational Needs & Disabilities: Information, Advice and
Notice.Description:
Hull City Council (HCC) is seeking suitably qualified and experienced providers to deliver a range of services for children with special educational needs or a disability and for children who are looked after by the Local Authority.
The contract will commence on 1 February 2021 for 12 months. The contract will be divided into the following lots; Lot 1 - Special Education Needs and Disability Information, Advice and Support Service (SENDIASS) - for young people with Special Educational Needs or disabilities, for whom the Local Authority is responsible, providing a range of information and advice about education, health and social care. Lot 2 - Independent Visitors Service - a service which provides Independent Visitors who can visit, befriend and advise and help protect children and young people in the looked after system. Under the Children Act 1989 every looked after child has the right to an independent visitor. Lot 3- Advocacy Service - a service that promotes the rights of disabled children and young people who are looked after by the Local Authority or who receive over-night short breaks. In addition to delivering services for children with special educational needs or a disability and for children who are looked after by the local authority, we are seeking a provider who is able to deliver significant social value benefits for the city.

Notice.Title: WCC - Warwickshire Care at Home Services Lot 1 Spot Purchase - 2 - AWARD
Notice.Description:
Warwickshire County Council is seeking tenders from new providers for Lot 1 of their Care at Home services in Zones 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8.
The purpose of this tender is to secure additional reserve spot capacity within the domiciliary care market for the zones listed in the contract documents, to support commissioned services during periods of pressure and increased demand, to ensure that customers have access to timely services.
We are seeking responses from providers who are already established and operating within Warwickshire's identified Zones (see Geographical Map Appendix 5) or the immediate neighbouring areas.
The initial requirement is for a number of providers (between one and five) to provide capacity across the above Zones during periods of pressure, however the Council may award more than one contract per Zone. Furthermore, unsuccessful providers who pass the mandatory requirements (including stated thresholds) will be held on a reserve list and may be awarded a future contract for Zones if this is required to meet service pressures.
The aim of these services will be to deliver outcome based, personalised care to customers who have social care needs and may also have health care needs, to enable them and their informal carers to have choice and control over the support they receive, promoting independence while supporting them to achieve positive outcomes in all aspects of their life.

Notice.Identifier: National Museums Liverpool Waste Removal Services
Notice.Title: National Museums Liverpool Waste Removal Services
Notice.Description:
Will all who are sending a response to this tender, please ask for confirmation that we have received your submission in a separate email.
If you have not received this confirmation by 3pm on 3rd November, please contact us again
National Museums Liverpool are looking to commission an external provider to deliver a high quality and efficient waste removal service. This includes both municipal and recyclable waste collections from all of our public and non-public venues. We require an efficient, inclusive service so that we A) meet the needs required of our business, B) ensure a first class service for our visitors and C) up keep to health and safety standards. We are seeking to set up a contract for waste collection and removal for the following sites; Merseyside Maritime Museum, Museum of Liverpool, World Museum, Walker Art Gallery, Sudley House Art Gallery, Lady Lever Art Gallery, Dale Street Office Suite, Midland Railway Building and Juniper Street. Bidders are asked to submit a formal tender for the Waste Removal Service for the next 3 years.
Bidders are asked to submit a formal tender for a Waste Removal Services contract. We require to supply and maintain a full range of municipal and recyclable waste bins as required by each of the above venues. We require multiple weekly visits to all named sites to collect, remove and dispose of waste. We also require the inclusion of an on-demand service whereby we can request additional bin collections at peak times.
A key deliverable is that National Museums Liverpool are provided with a transparent service throughout the duration of the contract. We require access to clear, accurate and real time information which records and details the services provided. We require up to date details of how much of our waste is recycled and how our waste has been recycled. This information is to be provided with weekly reports and a maintained record system so that information of any visits, collections made etc. can be easily accessed and reported on.
Regular communication is key and we would expect the successful contractor to be in regular contact in the form of bi-monthly meetings.

Notice.Title: Provision of a Brand New Permanently Mounted Salt Spreader fitted to a compact tractor c/w Front Snowplough - AWARD
Notice.Description:
Mid Yorkshire Hospitals (The Authority) is seeking quotations for A Brand New Permanently Mounted Salt Spreader fitted to a compact tractor c/w Front Snowplough
We need our chosen supplier to deliver the Goods on or before the 31st March 2021.
If you are interested in quoting for this requirement, please reply with the following information: Details of goods to be supplied including make and model number and lead times for delivery. Completed pricing schedule.
The Authority is seeking quotations from a number of suppliers. The following criteria will apply to the selection of the successful supplier:-
the supplier's offer that (a) meets all the requirements set out above (b) provides all information required as set out above (c) is the lowest price.
Your response must be valid for acceptance for 90 days from the deadline for receipt of quotations. Your response constitutes an offer and if the Authority accepts that offer then a legally binding contract will exist between us.
The Authority does not make any commitment to purchase and shall have no liability for your costs in responding to this Request for a Quotation.
The NHS Terms and Conditions for the Supply of Goods (Purchase Order version) (available on the Department of Health's website) will apply to any purchase.

Notice.Title: Redevelopment of Manchester Central website
Notice.Description: Manchester Central is currently looking for a website design and development Contractor to redevelop the www.manchestercentral.co.uk website for Manchester Central. The Contract will be for the initial redevelopment project with an anticipated Contract start date of February 10th, 2021. In addition, hosting and support packages will be required for a period of one (1) year from the launch of the website, with a Manchester Central only extension up to two (2) years following a review. The ongoing support Contract start date is anticipated as May 1st, 2021, dependent on project start date. Specifically, these two ongoing services (packages) required from the Contractor are: • Hosting, including 24/7 hosting support. The website server chosen by the service provider should be best suited to Manchester Central's requirements and be based in the United Kingdom. Any backup services employed must also be housed in the United Kingdom. The website is 'mission critical' in terms of providing an ecommerce and event bookings platform and your hosting service should reflect that. Ongoing monitoring and optimisation of the website's effectiveness in reaching pre-defined business and marketing goals. This will be via 'CRO', ongoing User Experience research and optimisation and SEO health management. Our exact requirements will be discussed and finalised at the time of project placement.
